org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class PwsFileOutputSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsFileOutputSocket

  • public class PwsFileOutputSocket
extends java.lang.Object
    PwsFileOutputSocket organises data output to a single underlying data stream for the purposes of creating a persistent state of a PWS file. This includes realization of different file format versions and makes these differences opaque to the user. It also fully organises creation of an encryption cipher and its application to a block-segmented data stream.
    See Also:
    PwsBlockOutputStream, PwsRawFieldWriter

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PwsFileOutputSocket(java.io.OutputStream output, PwsPassphrase key, HeaderFieldList headerFields)
      Creates an output socket for the latest file format version (V3) and optional file generic header data.
      PwsFileOutputSocket(java.io.OutputStream output, PwsPassphrase key, HeaderFieldList headerFields, int fileVersion)
      Creates an output socket with full settings, including optional file generic header data.
      PwsFileOutputSocket(java.io.OutputStream output, PwsPassphrase key, int fileVersion)
      Creates an output socket with an empty header field list.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PwsFileOutputSocket

        public PwsFileOutputSocket(java.io.OutputStream output,
                   PwsPassphrase key,
                   int fileVersion)
        Creates an output socket with an empty header field list. (Essential header fields will be created with default values where necessary.)
        Parameters:
        output - the target output stream
        key - PwsPassphrase secret key for the encryption cipher
        fileVersion - file format version to be created (values of class Global)

      • PwsFileOutputSocket

        public PwsFileOutputSocket(java.io.OutputStream output,
                   PwsPassphrase key,
                   HeaderFieldList headerFields,
                   int fileVersion)
        Creates an output socket with full settings, including optional file generic header data.
        Parameters:
        output - the target output stream
        key - PwsPassphrase secret key for the encryption cipher (file access key)
        fileVersion - file format version to be created (values of class Global)
        headerFields - file generic header data in a HeaderFieldList (e.g. contains user options, file-UUID, etc.); may be null

      • PwsFileOutputSocket

        public PwsFileOutputSocket(java.io.OutputStream output,
                   PwsPassphrase key,
                   HeaderFieldList headerFields)
        Creates an output socket for the latest file format version (V3) and optional file generic header data.
        Parameters:
        output - the target output stream
        key - PwsPassphrase secret key for the encryption cipher (file access key)
        headerFields - file generic header data in a HeaderFieldList (e.g. contains user options, file-UUID, etc.); may be null

    • Method Detail

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys all sensible data in this object and renders it unusable. (This can be called without prior call to close().)

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes this socket but not the underlying output stream. (Includes a call to destroy().)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getFileID

        public UUID getFileID()
        Returns the file identifier UUID or null if it is not available. (Available only for V3 files)
        Returns:
        UUID file identifier value

      • getIterations

        public int getIterations()
        The number of security iterations of key calculation during file authentication or file-save.
        Returns:
        int number of calculation iterations

      • setIterations

        public void setIterations(int iterations)
        Sets the number of security loops of key calculation occurring during file authentication or file-save. The parameter value is corrected to comply to a minimum of 2048.
        Parameters:
        iterations - int number of calculation loops

      • getRawFieldWriter

        public PwsRawFieldWriter getRawFieldWriter()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Returns an object specialised to write PWS raw fields to the underlying data stream. Calling this will initially create the header of the new PWS file in the output stream.
        Returns:
        RawFieldWriter
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getBlockOutputStream

        public PwsBlockOutputStream getBlockOutputStream()
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Returns a data-block oriented output stream designed to realise the contents of a PWS data file to the underlying output stream. Calling this will initially create the header of the new PWS file in the output stream.
        Returns:
        PwsBlockOutputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
